body.p: A Kentucky attorney, politician, and lecturer of constitutional law. Educated in preparatory school. Studied law and admitted to the bar in 1851. Practiced law in Owensboro, Kentucky. Married to Lillia Pegram Triplett Yeaman in 1855. Father of Robert T. Yeaman, Stephen M. Yeaman, Lelia P. Yeaman, Jr., Virginia L. Yeaman Remnitz, and Anna H. Yeaman. Elected as Daviess County Court Judge in 1851. Elected as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1861. Served the Second Congressional District of Kentucky as Unionist member of the United States House of Representative from December 1861 to March 1865. Served as United States Minister to Denmark from 1865 to 1870.
